messageBody:
I don't think I understand ActiveTestSuite.

The best I can tell, I should be able to run the same suite simultaneously
in multiple threads by doing this:

static Test createThreadedTest(Test test, int numThreads) {
TestSuite ats = new ActiveTestSuite();
for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++)
ats.addTest(test);
return ats;
}

And this does basically that. But the problem is, all the threads are
acting on the same actual TestCase instances. Meaning that my test case
"firmament" becomes pretty much useless--an object I initialize in setUp()
might have been mucked with by another thread by the time I use it!

It has other side effects too. For example, suppose I have a TestListener
that records every test executed and the word "PASS" or "FAIL". Since JUnit
offers no callback method when a test passes (apparently it goes against
their philosophy), the only way to do this I've found is to set a "failed"
flag in addError() and addFailure() and check that flag in endTest(). But
if you use ActiveTestSuite, I'm sure you can figure out what can go wrong.

So, anyone know how ActiveTestSuite was intended to be used? Documentation
is very slight.

Thanks!
Kevin
